perturbation.original_text: Company. Twin Cities Power Generation, or its successors or assigns, if approved by Contractor as provided in Section 9.03,  below.
perturbation.changed_text: Company. Twin Cities Power Holdings, LLC, or its successors or assigns, if approved by Contractor as provided in Section 9.03,  below.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition in section 1.01 defines 'Company' as 'Twin Cities Power Generation'. However, the opening paragraph of the contract states it is between 'Twin Cities Power Holdings, LLC' and 'Redwater LLC'. Changing 'Generation' to 'Holdings, LLC' creates a contradiction. The agreement never defines Twin Cities Power Generation.

perturbation.original_text: Contractor. Redwater LLC, a Minnesota limited liability company, or its successors in interest or assigns, if approved by the  Company as provided in Sections 5.02(c) and 9.03, below.
perturbation.changed_text: Contractor. Redwater Inc., a Minnesota limited liability company, or its successors in interest or assigns, if approved by the  Company as provided in Sections 5.02(c) and 9.03, below.
perturbation.explanation: The opening paragraph and the definition of Contractor are inconsistent. The initial paragraph names 'Redwater LLC', whereas the definition names 'Redwater Inc.'. This creates confusion on whether the legal parties are correctly referenced.

perturbation.original_text:
In consideration of the agreement of the Contractor to provide its services as set forth in this  Agreement, the Company will pay the Contractor the following amounts:
     (i) a monthly service fee of $7.50 per note based on the maximum number of notes outstanding during the  month, subject to a monthly minimum of $2,500;
perturbation.changed_text:
In consideration of the agreement of the Contractor to provide its services as set forth in this  Agreement, the Company will remit to the Service Provider a flat rate of $10,000 monthly for their services:
     (i) a monthly service fee of $7.50 per note based on the maximum number of notes outstanding during the  month, subject to a monthly minimum of $2,500;
perturbation.explanation: By using the term 'Service Provider' in place of 'Contractor', there is an inconsistency of who is receiving compensation, the 'Contractor' or the undefined 'Service Provider'. Additionally, this clause includes a fixed monthly amount for contractor's service fees of 10,000 in contradiction to per note minimum fee of 2,500 and 7.50 per note
